RDU.value: An event whereby the exchange has concludes that the underlier to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives is a cash-only delivery net amount (Cash Settlement), therefore securities will be subject to an acceleration of the maturity/expiration dates for all remaining outstanding Listed Derivatives.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change to block trade size or block trade procedures.
An event whereby the exchange report a change in the contract size.
An event whereby the exchange reports a comparison between current and adjusted products' series contract sizes and or strikes.

An event whereby the exchange adjusts the undelier(s) to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives due to the determination of the final net dividend amount in case of a cash or special cash dividend distributed.
Deletion Of Adjusted Version & Relisting of Unadjusted Version

An event whereby the exchange reports to delete the adjusted listed derivative series created by the exchange to support an earlier event as there is no open interest in these securities. And in the same time relist new unadjusted listed derivative series adhereing to the standard contract specifications.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the format they deliver the data, or change in the data delivery method.

An event in where the exchange adjusts the underlier(s) to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives due to an determination of the final amount of the cash component resulting from cash in lieu.
An event in where a listed security is removed from an exchange
An event whereby a company splits off one or more divisions to operate independently or be sold off.
An event in where intermediate securities are distributed that gives the holder the right to take part in a future event.
An event whereby the exchange reports an upcoming change.
An event whereby dividend is paid to shareholders in the form of equities of another company then the issuing corporation.
An event whereby the exchange adjusts the underlier(s) to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives due to the expiration of the entitlement(s) distributed.
An event whereby the exchange reports a possible upcoming change, for which some details are known and others are not yet known.
An event in where security holders receive additional assets free of payment from the issuer, in proportion to their holding.
An event whereby the exchange group reports how the industry is supported in case of trading and/or clearing holiday of one or n exchanges belonging to that exchange group.

An event whereby the exchange reports a change to the last trade date(time) and or expiration date(time). NOTE: It's very well possible that other attributes will also change due to an amendment in the termination of trade (for example final settlement date, first and or last delivery date)
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the grade of the commodity.
An event whereby the exchange anticipates that the underlier to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives will become a cash-only delivery (Cash Settlement).
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the maturities available going forward for already existing listed derivatives products.
An event in where cash is distributed to shareholders, in proportion to their holding. Extraordinary or Special dividends are NOT recurring and regular.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in contracts belonging to a specific listed derivates products or all its listed derivate products to transfer to another exchange.

An event in where an offer is made to holders by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their securities.
The offer is made in securities or other forms of non-cash equivalents.
Change of the issuing company's name affecting also the descriptions of the instruments and securities as well as a change in their identifier(s).
Change of the issuing company's name affecting also the descriptions of the instruments and or securities.
An event whereby the exchange reports that a position held in a particular Listed Derivative contract, will be transfered into a position of another regular Listed Derivate contract.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the Penny Program or Penny Pilot Program, or changes in the option classes participating in quoting and trading of option classes in a Penny Program.
An event in where securities are going to be listed on an exchange.

An event whereby two relatively equal companies combine to become one legal entity with the goal of producing a company that is worth more than the sum of its parts. (Simplistic: Company A and Company B, become Company AB).
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the maximum amount (long or short) a trader may own or control as permitted by the regulator.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change to initial and or expanded daily price limits applicable.

An event in which a company moves its ‘domicile’ (or place of incorporation) from one jurisdiction to another by changing the state/country under whose laws it is registered or incorporated, whilst maintaining the same legal identity.

An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the conditions which led to the suspension/trading halt are no longer present, or resumption of trading will promote the maintenance of a fair, orderly and transparent market.
An event whereby a company creates an independent company through the sale or distribution of new shares of an existing business or division of a parent company.

An event whereby a company decreases it's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are increased accordingly.
An event which is characterized by the purchase of a smaller company by a much larger one.  (Simplistic: Company A and Company B, become Company A+B)
An event whereby the exchange report a change in the roundlot size of the security.

An event whereby a company increases it's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are decreased accordingly.

An event in where an offer is made to holders by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their securities.
The offer is made in the form of cash.

An event whereby the exchange report a trade halt or temporary suspension of trading for a security or group of securities at an exchange or exchange group. Typically enacted in anticipation of a news announcement, to correct an order imbalance, as a result of a technical glitch, or due to regulatory concerns.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the strike range (e.g. the number of available strikes below and above ATM), and or a change in the strike price minimum fluctuation.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the tick size and or tick value.
An event whereby dividend is paid to shareholders in the form of equities of the issuing corporation.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the minimum or maximum volume per order.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change to trading rules.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change in the day(s), time and or session when a security can be traded. This includes as well a change in Daylight Saving Time (DST) and or a trading holiday.
An event whereby the exchange reports a change to the final settlement date.
An Event Type where the exchange notifies that there is no adjustment to the Listed Derivatives.
An event of whereby the exchange reports a notification which is not anyone of the known event types, however is an event type supported under the EN service.
An event whereby the exchange adjusts the underlier(s) to be used in the settlement of Listed Derivatives due to a determination of the final quantity of underlier(s).
An event in where cash is distributed to shareholders, in proportion to their holding. Ordinary dividends are recurring and regular.

An event whereby a company decreases it's number of outstanding equities resulting in a change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the buyback. This will result in an increase in the relative ownership stake of each investor in the company since there are fewer shares/claims on the earnings of the company.
An event whereby a company makes a payment to it's shareholders which is drawn from its capital reserves. Opposed to regular dividends, which are paid from the company's earnings.
An event whereby the shareholders are entitled by the company to buy additional shares without receiving an intermediate security.
An event whereby the company reorganizes its operational process, legal structure, ownership structure or other structures, which potentially affects the underlying of the derivative.
